snippet: Nearly half of lumpectomy patients who had second operations may not have needed them, a new study finds.
abstract: Study finds that nearly half of the women who had lumpectomies for breast cancer had second operations they may not have needed because surgeons have been unable to agree on guidelines for the common procedure; authors of the study, published by The Journal of the American Medical Association, hope that it will help push professional groups to develop guidelines.
lead_paragraph: Nearly half of lumpectomy patients who had second operations may not have needed them, a new study finds.

headline.seo: Repeat Breast Cancer Surgery Guidelines Found Unclear
headline.main: Breast Cancer Surgery Rules Are Called Unclear
headline.print_headline: Breast Cancer Surgery Rules Called Unclear

keywords.value: Journal of the American Medical Assn
keywords.name: organizations
